function_reachability: Is it impossible for function 'printf' to reach function 'main'?
Is there a call path from function 'main' to function 'printf'?
loop_reachability: Is it possible that the loop with condition 'n<1000' is never executed?
Is the loop with condition 'n<1000' always executed?
Is it possible that the loop with condition 'a<n' is never executed?
Is the loop with condition 'a<n' always executed?
dominators: Is there at least one path that reaches the body of the loop with condition 'n<1000' without passing through its header block?
Is there at least one path that reaches the body of the loop with condition 'a<n' without passing through its header block?
data_dependency: Does the value assigned to 'argc' affect subsequent computations?
Does the value assigned to 'argv' affect subsequent computations?
liveness: Is variable 'argc' live at the end of function 'main'?
Is variable 'i' live at the end of function 'main'?
